body:
Oh, all of `superset/static/assets/src` except for `superset/static/assets/src/visualizations/CountryMap/` is now excluded. 

It's a bit confusing, but it's a mixed set of `recursive-exclude` AND `recursive-include`

If you fire up a python shell from that context and `import superset_config`, does it work?
Minor comment otherwise LGTM
@williaster I thought this was already possible as long as the chart and its backend code was already included in superset?

Try to change this in superset_config.py: 
```
# Will allow user self registration
AUTH_USER_REGISTRATION = False
```
It is very useful for us to manage the group by combination in the dashboard. It enables users to do multiple dimension analytics freely.
Is this feature still being developed? It seems a long time since the last update.
Have you found a solution for this ?
Superseded by https://github.com/apache/incubator-superset/pull/6453

@victornoel do you mind taking a look since you know most above the current docker setup?

Everything Superset-related LGTM

As explained by @victornoel my changes to change the port weren't necessary. I'll remove them.

@victornoel what do you think about tagging the superset image in `docker-compose.yml` with:
```
image: apache/incubator-superset:latest
```
Improved the solution to support saving the state properly, using its own redux store, autozoom, readonly and more.
LGTM

We should put maximum limit on the size of country maps, something like 400kb. I don't think we need most details on country maps especially that it usually used to represent provinces or states. 

If you wan't, I can try on my spare time reduce the size of Json maps and add more countries

Agreed, a few other things:
* we could gzip the files, de-gzip on the client
* should move the files to `static/data/geo` or something like that, then that needs to be in the manifest, really shouldn't be in `src/` ...
* that's more complicated, but we've been talking about how it should live in the database instead, @betodealmeida and I have been speaking about having some sort of GeoShape-related models
Please stop sending me emails and unsubscribe me

> As explained by @victornoel my changes to change the port weren't necessary. I'll remove them.
> 
> @victornoel what do you think about tagging the superset image in `docker-compose.yml` with:
> 
> ```
> image: apache/incubator-superset:latest
> ```

Maybe it's not desired, because the image built is a very dev-oriented image with extra stuffs. But If I wanted to tag it, I would use a simple name (because the `/` separated name implies it's on dockerhub?) and I would use the tag dev, debug or something like that.

Agood question to ask in order to know how to tag is: what would be the usage of such image outside of this docker-compoe?

Thanks @emeraldbay 
Rewriting above comment for more clarity as it took me a while to realise what the actual commands were.

`cd incubator-superset/contrib/docker`
`# prefix with SUPERSET_LOAD_EXAMPLES=yes to load examples:`
`docker-compose run --rm superset ./docker-init.sh`
`# you can run this command everytime you need to start superset now:`
`docker-compose up`
Did you skip `pip install -r requirements-dev.txt` ? Maybe you're missing `python-dotenv`. Otherwise maybe you are running the `flask run` command from outside the repo?
Also you might want to try the latest release candidate. https://pypi.org/project/superset/0.29.0rc7/
I am also facing the same issue. How can we solve this? @hughhhh did you find any hack for this?
@putop you manage your own Github notifications, nothing we can do on this end.

@mistercrunch Thanks a tonne dear Maxime. It finally worked. I did install the requirements-dev.txt. However, the python-dotenv module was not existing in that requirement file. I separately installed python-dotenv through "pip install python-dotenv" and the issue was fixed. The  https://pypi.org/project/superset/0.29.0rc7/ has the same python-dotenv module missing in its requirements files. Again, thank you.

> If you fire up a python shell from that context and `import superset_config`, does it work?

I have pycharm and suspend at that point, then run `import superset_config` , and got error ` could not find module superset_config`

please check you SUPERSET_HOME env setting

Hi,
I try to add some new visualizations, but the project structure has changed in version 0.28.1.Would you please update some samples?That will be very helpful.
Thank you.
I am also interested in this open question.

> please check you SUPERSET_HOME env setting
> […](#)

Is there any document in the tutorial says how to set SUPERSET_HOME ?
I am reading the data from redshift and trying to create chart in superset by grouping month wise but could not able to do since there is no option of grouping. What should I do ?

@adderRavi can you elaborate on what you are trying to do? Sounds like you want to use a month time grain. Also, if you are having trouble with RedShift I would appreciate if you could try #5827 as it fixes all problems I have been able to identify with RedShift and a few other SQL Alchemy engines.
same error here !

> SUPERSET_HOME

just add `export SUPERSET_HOME="path to config"` to your .bashrc or your .bash_profile in your home. Then restart your terminal.

If superset_home doesn't work change it with `export PYTHONPATH="path to config:$PYTHONPATH"
`
Was wondering how this effort is going ?

Due to our changing priorities, we have been unable to complete the dashboard level filters feature. You can find our in progress work on my feature branch (https://github.com/jaylindquist/incubator-superset/tree/feature/native-filter) and I can create a PR if you are interested in keeping what we've been able to start.

Completed tasks:
* Add a drag-and-drop filters container at the top of dashboards
* Add filters to the filter container (filters are added, but configuration is hard coded)
* Remove filters from container
* Remove filters container from dashboard
* Update Dashboard short links to create `preselect_filters` parameter without chart IDs. URL short links are now generated as `{ "column1": ["val1"], "column2": ["val2", "val3"] }`
* Update `preselect_filters` parameter to support filters without chart IDs while being backwards compatible. `preselect_filters` now supports the above format as well as the existing format `{ "chartId1": { "column1": ["val1"]}, "chartId2": { "column2": ["val2", "val3"]}}`

The following shows adding filters to an existing dashboard:
![superset-filters](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/222699/49760761-e1df6300-fc8a-11e8-9e97-c05ce4206cbf.gif)


There is still work to be done:
* Creating a modal to add new filters
* Manage date filters for each datasource
* Global filter configuration (for example, instant filtering)
* Saving selected filter options when the dashboard is saved

If you would like me to create a PR for this work, let me know. I apologize for not being able to complete the feature, but other tasks took priority for us.
Closing this because the other, already merged, approach turned out to be better.

I don't think that fully works as `has_access` is used beyond Superset inside FAB. I feel like security configuration overrides should be done through `SupersetSecurityManager`, which operates through FAB's `SecurityManager`. My feeling is that we should do this inside FAB itself if needed. Happy to help dig through to find the best approach.
Going to make a call on this one and merge it. We're committed to get this feature to work well.

it's to execute script with some parameter by calling an url. The script is a flask view. I need an interface to set the parameters.

I find a hacky way to do that : 
1. you create your marckup
2. you click on the button to use it as an iFrame and you copy the src parameter
3. you create a new iframe ; you paste the src in the src block

Ooops conflict. I think you'll have to rebase and re-pip-compile.

HighCharts has a funky license. The first version of Superset relied on it and after reading the license I removed it in favor on NVD3. Now NVD3 is becoming pretty dated and isn't well supported. I think the plan is to move to data-ui on the long run. https://github.com/williaster/data-ui

Also visualizations are in the process of becoming plugins, so hopefully the community builds more options too.
